Quick buying summary

  • For most homes, a 5-6 qt air fryer offers the best balance of capacity and counter space.
  • Single baskets are simpler and cheaper; dual baskets help if you cook full meals at once.
  • Focus on airflow power and easy-clean coatings; presets and apps rarely matter.

How to choose the right Air Fryers

Our evaluation framework focuses on practical factors that affect everyday use.

Pick the right size

1–2 people

2–4 qt

Faster cooking, takes less space.

3–4 people

5–6 qt

Best balance for most homes.

5+ people

7+ qt or dual basket

Fewer batches, easier full meals.

Buying considerations

Single basket vs dual basket

  • Single basket: cheaper, simpler, best for beginners.
  • Dual basket: cook two foods at once, better for families, costs more and takes more space.

Price vs value

  • $60–$120: basic controls, less consistent airflow.
  • $120–$200: best value with even cooking and a solid build.
  • $200–$300: dual baskets and convenience features.
· · ·

Features that actually matter

Features that matter

  • Capacity — determines how often you cook in batches
  • Airflow power — affects crispiness and speed
  • Basket coating — makes cleaning easier and helps it last longer

Features you can ignore

  • Dozens of presets
  • App connectivity
  • Fancy touchscreens
· · ·

Common mistakes to avoid

  • Buying too small "to save space"
  • Overpaying for features you won't use
  • Ignoring basket cleaning and maintenance
· · ·

Who this is / isn't for

Best for

  • You want faster weeknight meals with less oil
  • You care about easy cleanup and reliable crisping
  • You want a model sized to your household

Not ideal for

  • Large households cooking full meals in one batch
  • Anyone who already uses a convection oven daily
· · ·

FAQ

How are these rankings created?

Rankings are created using data-based review technology that analyzes publicly available product information, review trends, and availability. Each list follows the same evaluation criteria to ensure fair comparisons.

What does the “Best overall” tag mean?

We use “Best overall” for the option that performs well across the most important factors—core performance, ease of use, build quality, and price—without major trade-offs.

What does the “Best value” tag mean?

“Best value” highlights the pick that delivers the most for the money: strong performance and reliability at a lower price, even if it skips premium extras.

What matters most when comparing models?

Focus on consistent cooking results, easy cleanup, and value that fits your routine; extra presets rarely change daily use.

Are more expensive models always better?

Not always. Higher-priced models often add convenience features, while core cooking performance can be similar in mid-range picks.

How often are rankings updated?

Rankings are reviewed regularly based on availability, pricing changes, and new product releases.
